intro: Codonoboea pectinata, commonly known as the pectinate codonopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Indonesia, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a distinctive pectinate (toothed) margin, giving it its common name. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and delicate blossoms.
